page.title: 10FLOWERS IN CHILMARK/TEFFONT
page.content: In{January}the first hazel catkins appear. In{February}churchyards become white with snowdrops. Dandelions and celandines come out in fields and hedgerows. By{Easter}daffodils and forsythia are in bloom. Hawthorn buds are bursting. The churches will be brightly decorated. Woods and hedgerows hold primroses and anemones. Cowslips flower in unimproved pastures Lanes are bordered with Ladies Lace, white Cow Parsley. Orchids may be found where downland has not been ploughed or fertilised. Downland flowers are brightest in{July,}when Scabious,Knapweed, Wild Mignonette, scarlet poppies are out and Meadow Sweet, Willowherb and Angelica by the streams.{Autumn}comes, then{Winter rest.Plants and seeds prepare for a New Year wakening. D.L.FORBES
